perturbation.original_text:
The Parties hereby agree to remove Schedule C-1 in its entirety and replace it with the following:

Schedule C-1. The following is attached to an incorporated into the Agreement as Schedule C-1:

Schedule C-1([***])

[***]
perturbation.changed_text: The Parties hereby agree to remove Schedule C-1 in its entirety.
perturbation.explanation: Removing the replacement clause for Schedule C-1, while the agreement still refers to Schedule C-1 in other sections (specifically mentioning incorporating it into the agreement), creates a contradiction. There's no longer a defined Schedule C-1, but the contract implies its existence, leading to uncertainty regarding the obligations or terms that were previously defined in that schedule.

perturbation.original_text: Except as otherwise specified above in this Amendment, all other terms, conditions and covenants of the Agreement shall remain in full force and effect.
perturbation.changed_text: Except as otherwise specified above in this Amendment, all other terms and conditions of the Agreement shall remain in full force and effect.
perturbation.explanation: By removing 'covenants' from the section stating which parts of the original agreement remain in effect, there is now uncertainty as to whether previous covenants are still enforceable, especially if those covenants relied on Schedule C-1 or other amended sections. This is because if other sections still reference 'covenants', but this amending statement removes them, there will be issues surrounding how to enforce covenants.

perturbation.original_text:
WHEREAS, Heritage and Premier entered into the Agreement;

WHEREAS, the Parties wish to amend the Agreement in accordance with the terms and conditions set forth herein.
perturbation.changed_text:
WHEREAS, Heritage and Premier entered into the Agreement;

WHEREAS, the Parties wish to amend the Agreement in accordance with the terms set forth herein.
perturbation.explanation: By removing 'conditions' from this section, there is now uncertainty if previous conditions are still enforceable, especially if those conditions relied on Schedule C-1 or other amended sections. This introduces an internal contradiction because while the original agreement had conditions, the amendment now seemingly ignores them.
